message.content:
cs.CV, cs.MM, cs.SD, cs.LG, cs.GR 

The paper presents a learning-based approach for automatic music video generation, which involves generating human skeleton sequences from music and applying pose-to-appearance mapping to generate the final video. This involves the use of discriminators and a novel pose perceptual loss to produce natural dances. Therefore, the paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV), Multimedia (cs.MM), Sound (cs.SD), Machine Learning (cs.LG), and Graphics (cs.GR) sub-categories.
